categories.issues: Procurement inefficiencies and sole-source contracts inflate costs. Long mandatory service creates hidden economic drag.
categories.alternative: Competitive bidding for non-classified procurement; streamlined reserve duty system.

categories.issues: Multiple parallel education streams with redundant administration. Below-OECD PISA scores despite significant spending.
categories.alternative: Unified standards with school autonomy; performance-based funding; reduced bureaucratic layers.

categories.issues: Fragmented delivery across multiple agencies. High administrative cost per beneficiary. Means-testing creates poverty traps.
categories.alternative: Consolidated welfare delivery; negative income tax model; digital-first service delivery.

categories.issues: Chronic underfunding leads to long wait times. Hospital bed shortage at 2.2 per 1000 vs OECD 4.3. Peripheral area access gaps.
categories.alternative: Increased competition among HMOs; public-private partnerships for hospitals; telemedicine expansion.

categories.issues: Debt service is largely mechanical. Rising debt-to-GDP ratio limits future fiscal flexibility.
categories.alternative: Fiscal responsibility framework; debt ceiling legislation; sovereign wealth fund for surpluses.

categories.issues: Massive cost overruns on infrastructure projects. Tel Aviv metro decades behind schedule. Poor inter-city rail connectivity.
categories.alternative: Independent project oversight; international competitive tenders; congestion pricing to fund transit.

categories.issues: Understaffing in peripheral areas. Slow adoption of technology for crime prevention. Uneven resource allocation across districts.
categories.alternative: Data-driven policing; community policing models; technology-first approach to crime prevention.

categories.issues: ILA monopoly on 93% of land. 13-year average permit time. Regulatory capture by incumbents blocks reform.
categories.alternative: Land reform to break ILA monopoly; streamlined permitting to under 2 years; zoning deregulation.

categories.issues: Heavy subsidies distort markets. Import quotas on food raise consumer prices. Water subsidies encourage inefficient use.
categories.alternative: Phase out import quotas; market-rate water pricing; direct farmer support instead of price controls.

categories.issues: Absorption services duplicate existing welfare programs. Language training quality inconsistent. Professional license recognition too slow.
categories.alternative: Streamlined license recognition; voucher-based language training; integration with existing social services.

categories.issues: Funding concentrated in central Israel. Political influence on cultural funding decisions. Lack of outcome measurement.
categories.alternative: Geographic funding equity; arm's-length funding body; matched private-public funding models.

categories.issues: Small budget relative to environmental challenges. Enforcement capacity limited. Slow renewable energy transition.
categories.alternative: Carbon pricing to generate revenue; polluter-pays enforcement; green bond financing for infrastructure.

categories.issues: Catch-all category with limited transparency. Coalition fund allocations lack oversight. Difficult to audit.
categories.alternative: Zero-based budgeting for miscellaneous items; sunset clauses on all discretionary programs.
